poem:
"Living Feast, Fasting Life"

This Is Just To Say, Dr. Mosley,
the bodily gardener,
who tilled health on the fertile 
isle of Symi, has faded.
He parsed calories and mapped
our hunger into science,
a table spread lean with fasting,
abundant in knowledge.

Gone— like half a plum
from the icebox,
his searing wisdom remains,
reshaping our appetitive lives.
Feast on, Doctor,
in the endless orchard,
where death is only an aftertaste.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dr Michael Mosley obituary Dr Michael Mosley, who has died aged 67 on the Greek island of Symi, explored health and fitness issues of interest to big audiences. He was a versatile communicator, whether as television diet guru, newspaper columnist or podcaster. He became a household name for diet books promoting calorie reduction and fasting, including The Fast Diet (2013), written with the journalist Mimi Spencer. His work gained in popularity from his self-experimentation, which". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
